question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson's campaign raise over $50 million before the Republican National Convention in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 15, 2024, Tucker Carlson's campaign announces that it has raised more than $50 million in total contributions. The total must be confirmed by official campaign financial disclosures or reliable reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The amount raised must be net of any refunds or returns of contributions. If the campaign is dissolved or ceases to operate before this date, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will his campaign raise over $50 million before the Republican National Convention?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (2) Before July 15, 2024, Tucker Carlson's campaign announces that it has raised more than $50 million in total contributions, confirmed by official campaign financial disclosures or reliable reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The amount raised must be net of any refunds or returns of contributions. If the campaign is dissolved or ceases to operate before this date, this condition will not be met. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Tucker Carlson's campaign raise over $50 million before the Republican National Convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Before July 15, 2024, Tucker Carlson's campaign announces that it has raised more than $50 million in total contributions. This must be confirmed by official campaign financial disclosures or reliable reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The amount raised must be net of any refunds or returns of contributions. If the campaign is dissolved or ceases to operate before this date, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson receive endorsements from major Republican figures before the primaries?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives official endorsements from at least three major Republican figures who have held significant political office (e.g., former presidents, governors, senators, or party leaders). Endorsements must be made public through reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through official social media channels of the endorsers. The endorsements must be unequivocal and not merely supportive statements. If endorsements are made by figures who have previously endorsed Carlson in a non-political context, those do not count. In the event of conflicting endorsements, the resolution will be based on the first official endorsement received.

The endorsements must be made public through reputable news sources or through official social media channels of the endorsers and must be unequivocal. Endorsements in a non-political context or merely supportive statements do not count. In the event of conflicting endorsements, the resolution will be based on the first official endorsement received.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson participate in the Republican primary debates in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Tucker Carlson officially participates in any of the Republican primary debates scheduled for the 2024 election cycle. Participation is defined as being present on stage and engaging in the debate format as established by the organizing body of the debate. Confirmation of participation must come from reputable sources, including announcements from Carlson himself, the Republican National Committee, or major news outlets such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN. If Carlson attends any debate but does not actively participate (e.g., due to withdrawal or being unable to participate for any reason), the question will resolve as No. In the event that the debates are canceled or altered significantly, the resolution will be based on the final confirmed schedule of the debates as of December 31, 2024.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson both be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and participate in the Republican primary debates in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Tucker Carlson officially participates in any of the Republican primary debates scheduled for the 2024 election cycle. 

Details for resolution:

(a) For Tucker Carlson to be considered the Republican nominee, he must be selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the selection by the convention is what counts.

(b) For Tucker Carlson to be considered as having participated in the Republican primary debates, he must be present on stage and engage in the debate format established by the organizing body. Confirmation must come from reputable sources, including announcements from Carlson himself, the Republican National Committee, or major news outlets such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN. If he attends any debate but does not actively participate, the question will resolve as No. If the debates are canceled or altered significantly, the resolution will be based on the final confirmed schedule of the debates as of December 31, 2024.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following events occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Tucker Carlson officially participates in any of the Republican primary debates scheduled for the 2024 election cycle. 

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For part (b), participation is defined as being present on stage and engaging in the debate format as established by the organizing body of the debate. question.title: Will Tucker Carlson secure more than 30% of the Republican primary vote in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, in the Republican primary elections of 2024, Tucker Carlson receives more than 30% of the total votes cast in any state or national primary event, as reported by reputable news sources such as the BBC, The Guardian, or the New York Times, and verified by official election results. The percentage must be based on the total votes counted for all candidates in the primary. If there are multiple primaries, the resolution will be based on the cumulative percentage across all primaries held in 2024. In the event of a contested primary where results are disputed, the final certified results from the appropriate election authority will be used to determine the outcome.

question.title: Will Donald Trump run for President again after 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Donald Trump officially announces his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election through a public statement, press release, or official campaign launch. The announcement must be reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN). Any informal indications or speculation about his candidacy will not count towards the resolution. If he announces his candidacy after December 31, 2024, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family hold a significant political office by 2026?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, any member of the Trump family (defined as Donald Trump, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Tiffany Trump, or Barron Trump) holds a significant political office in the United States. Significant political office includes positions such as President, Vice President, U.S. Senator, U.S. Representative, Governor of a state, or any other elected office at the state or federal level that is recognized as significant by the general public and media. The office must be held in an official capacity and not in a temporary or appointed role without electoral validation. The confirmation of the office held must be reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

question.title: Will the Trump family influence the Republican Party's platform in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, there is clear evidence that the Trump family has significantly influenced the Republican Party's platform for the 2024 election. This influence can be demonstrated through one or more of the following: 1. Official statements or endorsements from prominent Trump family members (such as Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, or Donald Trump Jr.) that are incorporated into the party's official platform. 2. The inclusion of policy proposals or positions in the Republican Party platform that are directly aligned with the public statements or actions of the Trump family. 3. Major media coverage (from reputable sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post) indicating that the Trump family's views or directives have been adopted or prioritized by the Republican Party leadership. If the influence is evident but limited to local or state-level platforms without national significance, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family participate in a televised debate during the 2024 election cycle?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, during the 2024 election cycle, any member of the Trump family (defined as Donald Trump, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., or Tiffany Trump) participates in a televised debate that is officially recognized as part of the primary or general election debates by a major political party in the United States. The televised debate must be broadcasted on a major network or cable channel and must include a live audience. The participation must be confirmed by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official announcement from the Trump family or their representatives. Participation in non-televised debates or debates organized by minor parties or independent candidates does not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will the Republican Party's voter base support Donald Trump in the general election if he is nominated?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, during the general election on November 5, 2024, at least 70% of registered Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their candidate, as measured by a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research Center) or through exit polls conducted on election day. Support must be defined as those who indicate they will vote for him on their ballot. If he is not the nominee, the question resolves as No. Additionally, if there are significant reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) indicating that a majority of Republican voters do not support Trump, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and receive at least 70% support from registered Republican voters in the general election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) During the general election on November 5, 2024, at least 70% of registered Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their candidate, as measured by a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research Center) or through exit polls conducted on election day. Support is defined as those who indicate they will vote for him on their ballot. If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either (a) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) the Republican Party's voter base support him in the general election if he is nominated?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, during the general election on November 5, 2024, at least 70% of registered Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their candidate, as measured by a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research Center) or through exit polls conducted on election day. Support must be defined as those who indicate they will vote for him on their ballot. If he is not the nominee, the question resolves as No. Additionally, if there are significant reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) indicating that a majority of Republican voters do not support Trump, the question will resolve as No.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump face legal challenges that could impact his candidacy before the 2024 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces any legal challenges that have the potential to significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election. Significant impact is defined as: 1) Indictments or formal charges filed against him that lead to a trial; 2) A court ruling that restricts his ability to campaign or participate in the election; 3) Legal challenges that result in a substantial change in public perception or support, as reflected in polling data. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to be considered valid for this resolution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump win the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is the Republican nominee?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump wins the 2024 United States Presidential Election, which takes place on November 5, 2024. The resolution will be based on the official certified results from the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or the National Association of Secretaries of State (NASS). If there is any dispute regarding the election results, the question will resolve as Yes if Trump is declared the winner by a majority of electoral votes (at least 270) and there are no significant legal challenges that alter this outcome. If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not appear on the ballot or withdraws before the election, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump announce his candidacy for the 2024 election before the end of 2023?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump publicly announces his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election before January 1, 2024. The announcement must be made through a credible medium, such as a press conference, official social media account, or a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Any informal statements or speculation regarding his candidacy will not count towards this resolution.
